alert.note: Alert for Boone; Braxton; Cabell; Clay; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Wayne; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:05AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Boyd, Lawrence, southeastern Lawrence, Calhoun, Kanawha, Putnam, Lincoln, Roane, north central Wyoming, southern Jackson, Wayne, central Mason, Cabell, west central Nicholas, northwestern Mingo, southern Gilmer, central Lewis, western Braxton, northwestern Raleigh, Logan, Clay, northwestern Fayette and Boone Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 404 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ripley to Collista. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Huntington, Nitro, Ripley, Madison, Louisa, Spencer, Winfield, Logan, Wayne, Hamlin, Proctorville, Clay, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans and Dunbar. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 53, and between mile markers 72 and 86. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 141. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 8 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 67 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Braxton; Cabell; Clay; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Wayne; Wyoming
